thread.title: El Paso-Gridley will go for threepeat in Class 1A boys golf
thread.title_full: El Paso-Gridley will go for threepeat in Class 1A boys golf

author: Staff
title: El Paso-Gridley will go for threepeat in Class 1A boys golf
text: Posted Oct. 12, 2015 at 9:08 PM Staff Journal Star Posted Oct. 12, 2015 at 9:08 PM The two-time defending Class 1A state champions return to the state finals via its second-place finish Monday at its own sectional at El Paso Golf Club. EP-G shot a 335 team total, which was one stroke more than champion Bloomington Central Catholic. Interestingly, BCC and El Paso-Gridley finished one-two in the Dwight Regional with the Saints winning by 25 shots. “We didn’t play very well at regionals,” said EP-G coach Ken Colmone. “I was a little nervous going into today. Didn’t know how we would react. “But we battled all day in some snotty conditions. I’m very proud of this team.” Senior Brady Colburn, who played on the Titans’ back-to-back state championship teams, led the Titans with a 78 on a windswept day. Colburn’s 78 was the third best score of the day. Urbana U-High’s Varun Chopra was medalist with a 1-under-par 70. Henry’s Jake Kennedy advanced as an individual. He shot 79. At Hamilton: Cole Fox and Maverick Wixom, both of Peoria Christian, were the only area competitors to advance. Fox shot an 83 and Wixom an 86 at Deer Run Golf Course. PC finished fourth as a team with a 361 aggregate, three shy of third-place Rock Island Alleman. Quincy Notre Dame won with a 331. QND’s Drew Eaton was medalist with a 5-over 77. At Byron: Sophomore Caleb Dzierzynski of Putnam County was the best of three individual entrants at Prairie View Golf Club with his 85. He had nines of 45-40 and missed advancing by two shots. Class 3A At Alton: Junior Lance Hays and sophomore Mason Ghidina will represent Pekin in the state finals. Hays and Ghidina both shot 79 at Spencer T. Olin Golf Course to advance. Edwardsville's Tanner White was medalist with a 1-under 71 which helped his teammates to the team title with a 308 total. Staff
